summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, setting a firm trial date of November 29, 2021, and establishing a schedule for jury selection procedures including a juror questionnaire and voir dire. It also schedules a telephone conference and an in-person pretrial conference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order is issued, setting her trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order, setting the trial date and procedural schedule.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, as evidenced by this scheduling order.

events.title: Trial Commencement
events.description: The jury trial in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to commence.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Jury Selection
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters.

events.title: In-Person Pretrial Conference
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for an in-person pretrial conference.

events.title: Court Informs Parties of Tentative Trial Date
events.description: The court informed the parties it set a tentative trial date for November 29, 2021.

events.title: Court Sets Original Schedule
events.description: The court set an original schedule, which is referenced and amended by this order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A firm trial date for Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case was set for November 29, 2021.
Jury selection procedures include administering a juror questionnaire on November 4, 5, and 12, 2021, and conducting voir dire from November 16-19, 2021.
The order schedules a telephone conference for October 21, 2021, and an in-person pretrial conference for November 1, 2021.
The parties are required to submit a joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire by October 11, 2021.
The order is issued by United States District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
